author: .paulharris
content:
I got some questions today about rates of onboarding / exiting validators ...

Interestingly, I had assumed our onboarding / exiting rate in Deneb was symmetric , but it isn't because we added `get_validator_activation_churn_limit` which puts a max onto the activation...
https://hackmd.io/@rolfyone/SyvVSZ6iye

i wrote up some random references etc to the spec ... and raw numbers...

Basically at electra we'd be looking at MAX on both activation AND exit, and in Deneb only the activation is locked in.

I guess my question is, for mainnet we're basically reducing the exit rate almost by half, and did we want to do that? I'm wondering if we're better off not doing that...

author: .paulharris
content: Mikhail said it was intentional so thats good... im not sure why but i can dig on that later...

author: radekkapka
content: Hey, I don't think it's related because this is post-Electra so there are no aggregation bits in the attestation. It's our node that returns two different states for the "same" attestation
